DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine effect 3 type sensory-targeted rehabilitation intervention subjective objective measure function chronic ankle instability . The investigator hypothesize subjective objective measure function include self-reported disability , balance , range motion improve 2-weeks sensory-targeted intervention .
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study determine effect 3 type sensory-targeted rehabilitation intervention subjective objective measure function chronic ankle instability . If potential participant deem eligible participation consent participate , he/she undergo pretest session balance , gait , range motion assess . The participant randomize one 4 treatment group undergo first treatment take approximately 5 minute . After completion first treatment , participant immediately retested balance , gait , range motion measure . Upon completion test first day , participant treatment group ask return 5 treatment course 2 week . Upon completion treatment , participant test balance , gait , range motion . Then , 1 month , participant contact self-reported function follow-up visit he/she ask report stable functional his/her ankle past month .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male female 1845 year age 2 . History ankle sprain least two episode `` give way '' within past six month 3 . Score ≥ 5 Ankle Instability Instrument ( AII ) 4 . Score ≤ 90 % Foot Ankle Ability Measure ( FAAM ) Activity Daily Living ( ADL ) Subscale 5 . Score ≤ 80 % FAAMSport Subscale . 1 . Younger 18 old 45 year 2 . No history ankle sprain episode `` give way '' past six month 3 . Score ≤ 5 Ankle Instability Instrument ( AII ) 4 . Score ≥ 90 % FAAMADL 5 . Score ≥ 80 % FAAMS . 6 . An acute ankle sprain within past 6 week . 7 . Previous history low extremity surgery internal derangement , reconstruction , repair 8 . Lower extremity injury within past 6 month ( ankle sprain ) 9 . Presence balance deficit condition know affect balance note Balance Questionnaire include diabetes and/or vertigo .
